meanings.definition: To cause to forget or unlearn something previously taught.
meanings.sent1: Her patient explanation unteaches the confusion in my mind.
meanings.sent2: The teacher unteaches the incorrect math method the student learned.
meanings.sent3: The playful game unteaches the seriousness of the lesson.
meanings.sent4: His calming voice unteaches the fear that was instilled.
meanings.sent5: The interactive video unteaches the traditional way of learning.

meanings.definition: To reverse the effects of teaching.
meanings.sent1: The new information unteaches the old misconceptions.
meanings.sent2: The educational program unteaches the outdated practices.
meanings.sent3: The humorous skit unteaches the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative approach unteaches the conventional methods.
meanings.sent5: The engaging activity unteaches the passive learning style.

meanings.definition: To undo the process of teaching.
meanings.sent1: The student's question unteaches the completion of the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected interruption unteaches the flow of the class.
meanings.sent3: The sudden change unteaches the planned structure of the course.
meanings.sent4: The technical issue unteaches the smooth delivery of the material.
meanings.sent5: The group discussion unteaches the individual focus of the session.
